indexCards.definition: A substance that, when dissolved, in pure water, increases the concentration of hydroxide ions
The study of the quantitative relations between amounts of reactants and products.
Substance that cannot be chemically broken down into simpler substances
Elements that make up Group 17 in the periodic table.
The actual yield is the amount of product you actually obtain from a chemical reaction, as in the amount you can measure or weigh as opposed to a calculated value.
Anything that has mass and takes up space.
State of matter with a definite shape and volume.
Way of writing the name of a compound using chemical symbols.
An alkali metal is a metal in Group I of the periodic table. Examples of alkali metals include lithium, sodium, and potassium.
An alkaline earth metal is an element belonging to Group II of the periodic table. Examples of alkaline earth metals are magnesium and calcium.
An energy level is a possible value of energy that an electron can have in an atom.
Enthalpy is a measure of the amount of energy in a system.
Substance that is changed in a chemical reaction.
Force of attraction that holds atoms together.
